intro: Belangera ulei, commonly known as yellow oleander, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually oval or lance-shaped. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types. However, it is important to note that all parts of the plant are toxic and should be handled with care.
